channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-11826] Split each tableOrRegionName admin methods into two targetted methods
item.description:
Purpose of this is two implement Enis Soztutar's suggestion to strongly type the methods that take "tableOrRegionName" as an argument.

For instance:


void compact(final String tableNameOrRegionName)

void compact(final byte[] tableNameOrRegionName)

becomes


@Deprecated

void compact(final String tableNameOrRegionName)



@Deprecated

void compact(final byte[] tableNameOrRegionName)



void compact(TableName table)



void compactRegion(final byte[] regionName)
item.summary: Split each tableOrRegionName admin methods into two targetted methods

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
First question about this refactor: Deprecate the old methods or remove them entirely?

One the one hand, deprecating them makes it easier for someone to move seamlessly to the new interface. On the other hand, this might muddy the new interface on day one. If a user is already putting in the effort to move to the new interface, shouldn't they just clean up these method calls at the same time?

Thoughts?
This patch is ready to upload. Just need a decision on whether to include the @Deprecated methods in the interface.
IMO, need to keep the old stuff for 1.0. This stuff has been around a long time so probably a few tools out there that rely on it. We want folks to be able to go from 0.94 to 1.0 w/o too much hassle.
Per stack's suggestion, I've attached a patch that leaves the old methods in the interface intact and deprecated. If we change our mind that's easy too.

Patch is looking good overall. A couple points of cleanup:

  • include deprecation annotations on the implementation methods, not just at the API layer.
  • implementation itself should be moved to the non-deprecated method, and the deprecated APIs should call to the new implementations when appropriate. For instance flush(byte[] tableNameOrRegionName) should do any parsing it needs to do and defer to flush(TableName) or flushRegion(byte[]) as appropriate.
Patch added with deprecation annotations. Methods refactored to put the logic in non-deprecated code paths.

In branch-1 we keep the old methods deprecated. In trunk we can remove?

stack listed a preference above to keep the deprecated methods. Can the crew please give me guidance, and I'll be happy to remove or leave in, as desired. I can appreciate both sides of the argument, so I'm somewhat ambivalent.

Carter Anoop Sam John is just pointing out that after this patch goes in, we can remove the deprecated methods (in new issue) in trunk. Makes sense to me. Lets get this into branch-1 and master first. @enis and Nick Dimiduk, you fellas good w/ this? Will commit tomorrow unless objection.

Admin is a new interface in 0.99+. Thus I think we do not want to include methods with tableOrRegionName args there. Let's keep them in HBaseAdmin though for BC. Agreed with Stack that we can focus on getting rid of all deprecated stuff for 2.0 later. I'll upload a new patch shortly.
@enis I like that (not adding to the new Interface but leaving in HBA)

Attaching v3 patch which removes deprecated methods from the Admin interface as per above.

A lof of changes due to this in test code resulting a 200K patch, but all changes are mechanical.

Will commit this version unless objection and if hadoopqa passes.
reattach.

it seems that some of the tests got killed during the jenkins run. I've run these tests, and they are passing with the test:

 

mvn clean test -Dtest=TestIdLock,TestMiniClusterLoadSequential,TestMergeTool,TestRegionSplitter,TestCoprocessorScanPolicy,TestTableInputFormatScan1,TestHFileOutputFormat2,TestAcidGuarantees,TestMiniClusterLoadEncoded,TestFSHDFSUtils
I've pushed this to branch-1+. Thanks Carter for the patch.
